author: brent.allsop
content:
In the last EIP IP meeting https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/blob/master/All%20EIPIP%20Meetings/Meeting%20031.md
Creating a separate ERC repository was discussed, which would effectively remove ERCs from the EIP repository.
Similarly, removing EIP 1 from the EIP repository has also been proposed.

We‚Äôve been adding these proposals to the WIP ‚ÄúEIP Signal Source Cleanup‚Äù document:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hUpMQh9gA5z3WSDvXKqU_CS6g3Y0hugJZHDYQdKxot8/edit

Sam Richards has been making some comments in that document and asking great questions.

Specifically, he is asking if we are going to remove EIP 1, do we intend on removing all meta EIPs, providing this link:
https://eips.ethereum.org/meta

As I indicated, it has been proposed in the last EIP IP meeting that we would create a new ERC repository, as a new separate home for ERC EIPs.

It seems to me, if we remove meta EIPs, we would similarly need to create an additional home for Meta EIPs to manage things like EIP 1.  Again, more work to find a maintainer of yet another git repository.

Sam mentioned that he read somewhere that a goal was to take network upgrades out of the EIP process.  Is this true?  If so, is this a separate proposal from the separation proposals above?

I‚Äôm trying to get educated on and collect all the issues around all this.  But it seems to me if we want to have a single source of truth for EIPs, what we have now seems ideal to me  Everything can be maintained in the same single source of truth repository  (far less work).
Also, for the people that want things to be separated, the tabs on eips.ethereum.org make this possible.  If one only wants core EIPs, without ERCs, they can just select on the core tab, right?

Anyway, for those proposing removing ERCs, EIP 1 and such from the EIP repository, does keeping things the way they are make sense?  If not, can you guys help me understand where we want to end up with all this?

author: sky.cactus
content: My dream (maybe not realistic, maybe not everyone agrees) is to get Ethereum specced out in a human readable set of markdown files in an eth-specs repository.  The change process would be PRs against that, which would me merged to master when a hard fork goes live.  This would obviate the need for either Core or Network EIPs and people could just submit spec PRs.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would also like to see the JSON-RPC specs moved into a similar format.

author: sky.cactus
content: That leaves Meta, Informational, and ERCs, which I'm far more ambivalent about.

author: sky.cactus
content: That is a pretty distant future I suspect though, as the act of speccing out all of Ethereum in a human readable form is a non-trivial task.
